thread.title: Wall's 24 points lead Wizards over Pelicans 105-19
thread.title_full: Wall's 24 points lead Wizards over Pelicans 105-19

author: AP
title: Wall's 24 points lead Wizards over Pelicans 105-19
text:
Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email Wall's 24 points lead Wizards over Pelicans 105-19 John Wall had 24 points and 13 assists, Markieff Morris scored 18 points and the Washington Wizards held New Orleans scoreless for the final 5:52 in the fourth quarter to beat the Pelicans 105-91 Saturday night for their seventh straight win Post to Facebook Wall's 24 points lead Wizards over Pelicans 105-19 John Wall had 24 points and 13 assists, Markieff Morris scored 18 points and the Washington Wizards held New Orleans scoreless for the final 5:52 in the fourth quarter to beat the Pelicans 105-91 Saturday night for their seventh straight win  //usat.ly/2k8EdoM   Wall's 24 points lead Wizards over Pelicans 105-19 AP 9:37 p.m. ET Feb. 4, 2017 New Orleans Pelicans forward Anthony Davis (23) goes to the basket past Washington Wizards forward Otto Porter Jr., back, during the first half of an NBA basketball game, Saturday, Feb. 4, 2017, in Washington. (AP Photo/Nick Wass) (Photo: The Associated Press) 
WASHINGTON (AP) â€” John Wall had 24 points and 13 assists, Markieff Morris scored 18 points and the Washington Wizards held New Orleans scoreless for the final 5:52 of the fourth quarter to beat the Pelicans 105-91 Saturday night for their seventh straight win. 
Washington has its longest winning streak since a seven-game stretch from Jan. 2-15, 2005. The Wizards extended their home winning streak to 17 games, second-longest in franchise history. 
Anthony Davis had 25 points and 10 rebounds to lead New Orleans, which lost its fourth straight. The Pelicans were held scoreless after Tyreke Evans hit a 3-pointer to take a 91-90 lead with 5:52 to play. 
Morris' dunk 12 seconds later put the Wizards ahead and started a game-closing 15-0 run.
